results.headline: Review: In ‘Independence Day: Resurgence,’ the Fault Is Not in the Fireworks
results.summary_short: All you really need to know about this sequel to the 1996 smash hit is that it took multiple men to cook up this pottage, which hinges on humanity battling aliens.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Independence Day: Resurgence

results.headline: Review: In ‘Hunt for the Wilderpeople,’ Lighting Out for the Bush
results.summary_short: Taika Waititi’s comedy centers on a foster child in New Zealand first placed with an older couple and then on the run.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Hunt for the Wilderpeople

results.headline: Review: In ‘Les Cowboys,’ a Girl Vanishes, and Her Father Can’t Bear It
results.summary_short: Directed by Thomas Bidegain, “Cowboys” uses the narrative codes of the classic western, like John Ford’s “The Searchers,” to tell a modern story.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Les Cowboys

results.headline: Review: ‘Three’ Asks, Any Mozart Aficionados in the House?
results.summary_short: This action-packed crime film by Johnnie To offers mayhem, comical desperation, surreal visuals and compounding excitement. Classical music, too.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Three

results.headline: Review: ‘From This Day Forward’ Attests to Love’s Adaptability
results.summary_short: Sharon Shattuck’s documentary tells her family story of growing up with a transgender parent.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of From This Day Forward

results.display_title: Eat That Question: Frank Zappa in His Own Words
results.headline: Review: ‘Eat That Question,’ on Frank Zappa, the Media and Cultural Upheavals
results.summary_short: A documentary about Zappa is rich in archival interviews that say worlds about this musician — who was well known but not well understood — and his times.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Eat That Question: Frank Zappa in His Own Words

results.headline: Review: In ‘The Kind Words,’ Siblings and a Secret
results.summary_short: This film, by the Israeli writer and director Shemi Zarhin, follows a family looking to uncover buried truths.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Kind Words

results.headline: Review: ‘T-Rex’ Fights Like a Girl. And That’s Worth Gold.
results.summary_short: Claressa Shields, the first female boxer to win an Olympic gold medal, is the indomitable center of Drea Cooper and Zackary Canepari’s impressive documentary.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of T-Rex

results.headline: Review: Matthew McConaughey Rebels Against Rebels in ‘Free State of Jones’
results.summary_short: Mr. McConaughey plays Newton Knight, the Mississippi farmer who led a dissident Confederate group in the Civil War, and a political coalition after.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Free State of Jones

results.headline: Review: ‘Swiss Army Man’ Is a Buddy Movie in Which One Pal Is Dead
results.summary_short: Starring Daniel Radcliffe and Paul Dano, this impossible-to-categorize film about a castaway and a corpse is an original mix of the macabre and the magical.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Swiss Army Man

results.headline: Review: Ranger vs. Preacher? In ‘The Duel,’ It’s No Contest
results.summary_short: Woody Harrelson, who plays a charismatic preacher, delivers a strong performance, but this film is largely characterized by unpersuasive story turns.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Duel

results.headline: Review: In ‘Right Now, Wrong Then,’ a Double Take and Its Choices
results.summary_short: The South Korean director Hong Sang-soo twice tells the tale of a first meeting between an older man and younger woman, with different outcomes.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Right Now, Wrong Then

results.headline: Review: ‘The Shallows’: Surfer Girl. Peckish Shark. Uh-Oh!
results.summary_short: Blake Lively stars as a young woman on a surfing mission in this thriller. But a really, really big shark has its own ravenous plans.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Shallows

results.headline: Review: ‘Wiener-Dog,’ the Tail That Wags Through a Few Bitter Lives
results.summary_short: As usual, Todd Solondz focuses on the awfulness of our species, dramatized in this film through dark, deadpan comic vignettes in the presence of a dachshund.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Wiener-Dog

results.headline: Review: In ‘The Neon Demon,’ Beauty Masks a Rotting Core
results.summary_short: This puerile movie from the Danish filmmaker Nicolas Winding Refn is set in the high-fashion modeling world of Los Angeles. Elle Fanning and Keanu Reeves star.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Neon Demon

results.headline: Review: In ‘Breaking a Monster,’ a Plea to Play Heavy Metal
results.summary_short: As three black seventh-graders from Brooklyn rise as potential music stars in this documentary, they must face much more than the music.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Breaking a Monster

results.headline: Review: ‘Septembers of Shiraz’ Revisits the 1979 Iranian Revolution
results.summary_short: This well-meaning yet nuance-free film focuses on a prosperous and friendly couple targeted for harassment during political upheaval.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Septembers of Shiraz

results.headline: Review: In ‘The Phenom,’ Landing on the Couch for Losing the Strike Zone
results.summary_short: A baseball movie with little baseball, this film asks: When a hot pitching prospect melts down, can an overzealous parent be far behind?

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Phenom

results.headline: Review: ‘Yarn’: And You Thought It Was Just for Knitting Mittens
results.summary_short: This documentary looks in on people working in yarn, from artists making graffiti to those fashioning playground structures.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Yarn

results.headline: Review: ‘Nuts!’ Reveals Doctor’s Secret to Success: Goat Testicle Transplants
results.summary_short: Penny Lane’s documentary about Dr. John Romulus Brinkley introduces a real-life Kansas con man who claimed to cure impotence with a peculiar kind of surgery.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Nuts!
